pullRequest.title: issue #1449 - build the capabilitystatement from the config
pullRequest.bodyText:
Now operators can configure the server to advertise only a subset of
resource types and/or interactions via the new resources config section
of fhir-server-config.json.
Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant lmsurpre@us.ibm.com

nodes.bodyText:
Personal preference.  "search".equals(interactionString)
Same for other else if checks in this method.
Variable is defaultInteractions, but this isn't just for defaults. Consider renaming variable.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            |`fhirServer/resources/<resourceType>/searchParameters/<code>/url`|string|null|
          
          
            
            |`fhirServer/resources/<resourceType>/searchParameters/<code>/url`|string or null|
          
      
    
    
  

should the pipe be considered an or ? the MD considers it a column delimiter
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1595,7 +1600,12 @@ through the shared lib at `wlp/user/shared/resources/lib`) |
 |`fhirServer/core/conditionalDeleteMaxNumber`|10|
 |`fhirServer/core/capabilityStatementCacheTimeout`|60|
 |`fhirServer/core/extendedCodeableConceptValidation`|true|
-|`fhirServer/searchParameterFilter`|`"*": [*]`|
+|`fhirServer/resources/open`|true|
+|`fhirServer/resources/Resource/interactions`|null (all interactions supported)|
+|`fhirServer/resources/Resource/searchParameters`|null (all global search parameters supported)|
+|`fhirServer/resources/<resourceType>/interactions`|null (inherets from `fhirServer/resources/Resource/interactions`)|
+|`fhirServer/resources/<resourceType>/searchParameters`|null (all type-specific search parameters supported)|
+|`fhirServer/resources/<resourceType>/searchParameters/<code>/url`|string|null|

nodes.bodyText: This is such a complicated stack to get here, it may be good to put a comment about the input and output as an ImplNote (not required, just a thought on how complex this Resource can be to build. )

commit.message:
Use FHIRConfigHelper over fhirConfig to support per-tenant capabilities

`FHIRResource.fhirConfig` is always using the default tenant.
Instead, we should use FHIRConfigHelper for most properties so that we
get that nice tenant->default fallback lookup.

This change focuses on the following properties:
* `fhirServer/core/capabilityStatementCacheTimeout`
* `fhirServer/security/*`

The former was marked as tenant-specific, but wasn't.  The latter was
marked as `N|N` but there was no reason for this since they are just
about controlling the CapabilityStatement and smart-configuration info.

In addition to useful behavior, this change puts us in a better position
for testing various configs more easilly.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Merge pull request #1601 from IBM/issue-1449-tests

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

fix the PROPERTY_SECURITY_CERT_ENABLED property path

in the sample config (and now the docs), we spell out certificates

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

Add tests for issues #1589 and #1449

We don't make it very easy to add component-level tests for our rest
layer.  This pull request works with what we have to test the public
JAX-RS methods for building the CapabilityStatement resource and the
smart-configuration JSON from various configs.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

removed TODOs and move tests to com.ibm.fhir.server.test package

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>
